Generation III.Ruby: Treecko has small hooks on the bottom of its feet that enable it to scale vertical walls. This Pok é mon attacks by slamming foes with its thick tail.
Generation III.Sapphire: Treecko is cool, calm, and collected - it never panics under any situation. If a bigger foe were to glare at this Pok é mon , it would glare right back without conceding an inch of ground.
Generation III.Emerald: It makes its nest in a giant tree in the forest. It ferociously guards against anything nearing its territory. It is said to be the protector of the forest's trees.
Generation III.FireRed: It quickly scales even vertical walls. It senses humidity with its tail to predict the next day's weather.
Generation III.LeafGreen: It quickly scales even vertical walls. It senses humidity with its tail to predict the next day's weather.

Generation IV.Diamond: The soles of its feet are covered by countless tiny spikes, enabling it to walk on walls and ceilings.
Generation IV.Pearl: The soles of its feet are covered by countless tiny spikes, enabling it to walk on walls and ceilings.
Generation IV.Platinum: The soles of its feet are covered by countless tiny spikes, enabling it to walk on walls and ceilings.
Generation IV.HeartGold: Small hooks on the bottom of its feet catch on walls and ceilings. That is how it can hang from above.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Small hooks on the bottom of its feet catch on walls and ceilings. That is how it can hang from above.

Generation V.White 2: The soles of its feet are covered by countless tiny spikes, enabling it to walk on walls and ceilings.

Generation VI.X: It quickly scales even vertical walls. It senses humidity with its tail to predict the next day's weather.
Generation VI.Y: Small hooks on the bottom of its feet catch on walls and ceilings. That is how it can hang from above.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Treecko has small hooks on the bottom of its feet that enable it to scale vertical walls. This Pokémon attacks by slamming foes with its thick tail.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Treecko is cool, calm, and collected—it never panics under any situation. If a bigger foe were to glare at this Pokémon, it would glare right back without conceding an inch of ground.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: The soles of its feet are covered by countless tiny hooks, enabling it to walk on walls and ceilings.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: The soles of its feet are covered by countless tiny hooks, enabling it to walk on walls and ceilings.

Generation IX.Scarlet: The small hooks on the soles of its feet latch on to walls and ceilings, so it will never fall even while hanging upside down.
Generation IX.Violet: Treecko can quickly scale even vertical surfaces. It senses humidity with its tail to predict the next day’s weather.

Generation III.Ruby: First partner Pokémon from Professor Birch on Route 101
Generation III.Sapphire: First partner Pokémon from Professor Birch on Route 101
Generation III.Emerald: First partner Pokémon from Professor Birch on Route 101

Generation IV.HeartGold: Received from Steven Stone in Silph Co. after defeating Red
